thread.title: A popular Devon nightclub is scrapping its £1-a-pint night - and has blamed Brexit

author: Richard Amofa
title: A popular Devon nightclub is scrapping its £1-a-pint night - and has blamed Brexit
text:
£1 pints are over and people can't believe it Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Devon nightclub has been forced to increase the price of its drinks – and has blamed Brexit for the new move. 
Switch nightclub, in Plymouth , was extremely popular for its £1-a-pint night, but the event is set to be scrapped due to rising beer prices enforced by Britain’s departure from the EU. 
The move has been branded by clubbers as “the worst news ever”. Read More Switch Plymouth 
Switch posted on their Facebook page: "#BlameBrexit 
"Unfortunately due to increasing prices on beer, £1 a pint will cease to continue from May :( . 
"This leaves us with four weeks to fill your boots on £1 a pint. 
HOWEVER, because we're awesome we've got you some brand new drinks offers in the pipeline to start from May 1st. 
"Watch this space!" 
Since the UK voted for Brexit in June 2016 the value of the pound has fallen, causing prices of imports from Europe to rise. 
However, the owner of Switch admitted the price rise is "not necessarily" linked to leaving the EU, he is just jumping on the bandwagon of blaming Brexit for everything, The Plymouth Herald report. Read More 
Marcus Lewis, owner of Switch said: "For us, it's a bit of a tongue and cheek thing, it's not necessarily because of Brexit but beer prices are rising again. 
"There's a lot of people blaming Brexit for everything, so we are too. 
"Every year in April we get our prices and have had to increase them." 
Mr Lewis said that the venue will be bringing in a new deal at the beginning of May, which will still offer competitive prices. Read More
